data.title: UIEditBox attachWithIME, detachWithIME make working
data.body:
it's not available editbox's attaching and detaching by programmatically.
i made it possible.

uieditbox already had imedelegate as a parent, and i overrode methods aboud ime attaching, detaching.

now it is available editbox's attaching and detaching by programmatically.
(android, iOS tested)

data.title: Add optional alpha parameter to Color4B and Color4F constructors
data.body: The constructors for `Color4B` and `Color4F` that take a `Color3B` parameter should also take an optional alpha parameter. This is for programmers' convenience. Since the alpha parameter defaults to full opacity, this change is backward compatible.

data.title: Enumerate getChildren() instead of _children.
data.body: `CCNode::getChildren()` is virtual. A base class can override getChildren() and return something different than `_children`. Therefore, when the children are enumerated using `doEnumerate()`, `getChildren()` returns the correct list.

data.title: cocos2d::extension::ScrollView::setContainer() should not call removeAllChildrenWithCleanup()
data.body:
Since 3.9 `removeAllChildrenWithCleanup` is overridden for ScrollView and will now remove all children from the _container.
setContainer calls `this->removeAllChildrenWithCleanup(true)`, which will remove all children of the current container before assigning the new container.

This is unexpected behavior and new to 3.9. I would expect that the current container's children are not removed when calling setContainer().

I believe that `this->removeChild(this->_container, true)` is the right way to go.

See also https://github.com/cocos2d/cocos2d-x/issues/8396.

data.title: cocos2d::extension::ScrollView::removeAllChildrenWithCleanup() should not remove _container
data.body:
Since 3.9 removeChild is overridden for ScrollView. The issue is that as part of this change removeAllChildrenWithCleanup will clear all children from the _container, and then remove the _container itself by calling the base implementation.
This will usually remove the last reference to _container, thus making the _container instance variable a dangling pointer.

Setting _container to nullptr is not an option, since the ScrollView depends on having a _container.
I think the method should not remove _container, just like UIScrollView will remove only the _container's children.

See also https://github.com/cocos2d/cocos2d-x/issues/8396.

data.title: Distance of press cancelling for button on scroll view has no interface for changing it.
data.body:
Distance of disabling widget highlight (and button press state) that is placed to ScrollView is located in variable _childFocusCancelOffsetInInch, but there is no interface for changing that variable.
Are you planning to add it?

data.title: Remove cocos2dx.h reference from all cocos studio related files
Detect Apple platforms
data.body:
As `/Applications/Xcode.app/Contents/Developer/Platforms/iPhoneOS.platform/Developer/SDKs/iPhoneOS.sdk/usr/include/TargetConditionals.h` documented:

```
    TARGET_OS_* 
    These conditionals specify in which Operating System the generated code will
    run.  Indention is used to show which conditionals are evolutionary subclasses.  

    The MAC/WIN32/UNIX conditionals are mutually exclusive.
    The IOS/TV/WATCH conditionals are mutually exclusive.


        TARGET_OS_WIN32           - Generated code will run under 32-bit Windows
        TARGET_OS_UNIX            - Generated code will run under some Unix (not OSX) 
        TARGET_OS_MAC             - Generated code will run under Mac OS X variant
           TARGET_OS_IPHONE          - Generated code for firmware, devices, or simulator 
              TARGET_OS_IOS             - Generated code will run under iOS 
              TARGET_OS_TV              - Generated code will run under Apple TV OS
              TARGET_OS_WATCH           - Generated code will run under Apple Watch OS
           TARGET_OS_SIMULATOR      - Generated code will run under a simulator
           TARGET_OS_EMBEDDED       - Generated code for firmware
```

That says:
- IOS/TV/WATCH is a subset of TARGET_OS_IPHONE.
- TARGET_IPHONE_SIMULATOR is also a subset of TARGET_OS_IPHONE.
- TARGET_OS_IPHONE is a subset of TARGET_OS_MAC.

data.title: 规范头文件
data.body:
目前 cocos2d-x 的头文件有这些问题：
## 1 搜索路径太多

以 Windows 为例，根据 cocos2d-x/cocos/2d/cocos2d_headers.props 需要搜索的路径有（不包含外部依赖）：

> $(EngineRoot)cocos
> $(EngineRoot)cocos\editor-support
> $(EngineRoot)cocos\platform
> $(EngineRoot)cocos\platform\desktop

虽然这样内部使用没有问题，但是影响其他项目中使用 cocos 头文件。

完全可以 **只搜索 `$(EngineRoot)cocos** 嘛。其他的就在这个路径上的相对路径进行包含就好了。
单一搜索路径的好处是便于设置编译：比如我要弄一个 Lua 模块，依赖 cocos 的 C++ 代码。我只要设置一个搜索路径就好了。
## 2 没有区分内部和公开头文件

目前没有独立的 include 目录，在代码变迁过程中难免出现有人不小心直接 `#include "abc.h"` 而不是用 `#include "relative/path/to/abc.h"`。

比如 `cocos/scripting/lua-bindings/manual/CCLuaBridge.h` 中就直接这样包含的： `#include "CCLuaEngine.h"` 这样导致第三方工程需要引用 `#include "scripting/lua-bindings/manual/CCLuaBridge.h"` 的时候，不得不把 `cocos/scripting/lua-bindings/manual` 添加到搜索路径里面。这样有加重了前面第1点。

这里的问题就是，没有区分内部头文件和导出的外部头文件。

如果`scripting/lua-bindings/manual/CCLuaEngine.h` 是公开 API，那么就应`scripting/lua-bindings/manual/CCLuaBridge.h`该使用`#include "scripting/lua-bindings/manual/CCLuaEngine.h"`。
如果 CCLuaEngine.h 不是公开的，那么就不该在头文件中引用它，而应该在 cpp 文件中引用。当然如果`CCLuaBridge.h` 也不是公开的，那么可以另当别论。

问题是，现在没有办法通过路径知道到底一个头文件是不是公开的 API。

所以需要 **专门建一个 include 目录放公开的 API 的头文件**。
## 3  cocos2d-x 内部一股脑地 #include "cocos2d.h"

现在 cocos2d-x 内部，只要动一下头文件，几乎是导致整个 cocos 重新编译。元凶就是 `#include "cocos2d.h"`。

解决办法就是 **用啥包含啥，不用别包含** 。

`cocos2d.h` 存在的意义就是提供给外部使用，帮助那些不太熟悉 cocos 的开发者，因为他们可能不太清楚，比如要用 Node 该使用哪个头文件。但是严谨的开发者在使用 cocos2d 的时候，不应该使用 `#incude "cocos2d.h"` 这样的方式。更不要说 cocos2d 内部代码了。

更糟糕的是，由于前面讲到的 第一二点 的关系，目前 cocos2d-x 的的头文件是在逼开发者在游戏项目中使用 `#incude "cocos2d.h"` 。
## 4 一个头文件里面包含太多内容

比如我想只使用 `platform/CCFileUtils.h` 结果：

> In file included from cocos/platform/CCFileUtils.h:33:
> In file included from cocos/base/ccTypes.h:36:
> In file included from cocos/platform/CCGL.h:33:
> cocos/platform/mac/CCGL-mac.h:32:9: fatal error: 'OpenGL/gl.h' file not found

原因就是 ccTypes.h 定义的和 OpenGL 相关的类型，而这些类型又依赖于 CCGL.h ，进一步要求依赖于 'OpenGL/gl.h'。 于是乎 一个 CCFileUtils 就依赖与 OpenGL 了。

data.title: Error in reference docs
data.body:
Right here:
http://www.cocos2d-x.org/reference/native-cpp/V3.2/d7/d7b/classcocos2d_1_1_physics_body.html#a181c3f106c811648c21bcbcad04e2219

It says applyImpulse will add a constant force and that applyForce will add an immediate force. This is backwards. impulse is an immediate force and applyForce applies a constant force.

Thanks for your support. This is a great project.

data.title: ControlSwitch causes crash
data.body:
`m_switch = ControlSwitch::create(sp_switch_off, sp_switch_on, sp_switch_off, sp_switch_thumb);`
I don't use 'onLabel' and 'offLabel', but when I run this program, it crashes.
Because in ControlSwitchSprite::initWithMaskSprite(), onLabel and offLabel are added to clipper without checking whether is null or not.

data.title: added CCTapRecorder extension.
data.body:
# Overview

This feature allows recording and playback gestures.
Both of them can be controlled via CCConsole, or directly from an instance of CCRecorder/CCPlayer.
The main purpose of this feature is to provide an easier way to implement UI testing.
# Features
- gesture and screen capture recording/playback
- file uploading/downloading by url
- dedicated CCConsole commands
# Usage
## via CCConsole
### Recording

**start**

```
> taprecorder record start some_save_name
```

**stop**

```
> taprecorder record finish
```
### Playback

**start**

```
> taprecorder play start some_save_name
```

**stop**

```
> taprecorder play stop
```
## via instances
### Recording

**initialize**

```
Recorder::getInstance()->init();
```

**start**

```
Recorder::getInstance()->record(DurationUnit::Frame);
```

**stop and save**

```
Recorder* recorder = Recorder::getInstance()
recorder->stop();
recorder->save("some_save_name");
```
### Playback

**play**

```
Player::getInstance()->play("some_save_name");
```

Notice :
Playback have to be began at the same point with recorder initialized.
Due to base time is counted up since recorder is initialized.

**stop**

```
Player::getInstance()->stop();
```
## Records

Recorded data is stored to application's writable directory in json format.
Although only json format is available currently, other format can be applied by implementing adapter.

data.title: Fix incorrect function name of getTrianglesCount
data.body:
There are a few typos in JS bindings and test cases:
- `getTriaglesCount` => `getTrianglesCount`

This pull request fixes them, thanks!
